results.adx_keywords: Trump, Ivanka;Kushner, Jared;Conflicts of Interest;United States Politics and Government;Trump, Donald J
results.byline: By ERIC LIPTON and JESSE DRUCKER
results.title: Trump Couple, Now White House Employees, Can’t Escape Conflict Laws
results.abstract: Jared Kushner and Ivanka Trump are walking on perilous legal and ethical ground, according to several prominent experts on the subject.

media.caption: Jared Kushner and his wife, Ivanka Trump, leave the Mar-a-Lago resort in Palm Beach, Fla. The couple’s real estate and investment empire is estimated to be worth as much as $740 million.

results.byline: By LARRY BUCHANAN, ANDREW W. LEHREN, JUGAL K. PATEL and ADAM PEARCE
results.title: How Much People in the Trump Administration Are Worth
results.abstract: A look at the personal wealth of top officials working for President Trump.

results.adx_keywords: Federal Budget (US);Trump, Donald J;Housing and Urban Development Department;Republican Party;Welfare (US);Ohio;Trumbull County (Ohio)
results.title: In Ohio County That Backed Trump, Word of Housing Cuts Stirs Fear
results.abstract: Some people in Trumbull County say they will suffer if home-repair, rental-assistance and other programs are eliminated as President Trump has sought.

media.caption: Joseph and Tammy Pavlic outside their home in Kinsman, Ohio. To repair the house, they tapped a program that President Trump is seeking to eliminate.
media.copyright: Maddie McGarvey for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Kushner, Jared;Trump, Donald J;China;Xi Jinping;Cui Tiankai;United States International Relations;Mar-a-Lago (Palm Beach, Fla);United States Politics and Government;International Trade and World Market
results.title: China Learns How to Get Trump’s Ear: Through Jared Kushner
results.abstract: Mr. Kushner’s role reflects the highly personal and bluntly transactional relationship between the United States and China, a risky strategy, experts say.

media.caption: President Xi Jinping of China is poised to arrive in Florida on Thursday for two days of meetings with President Trump.

results.adx_keywords: United States Politics and Government;Federal Courts (US);Appointments and Executive Changes;American Bar Assn;Supreme Court (US);Trump, Donald J;Gorsuch, Neil M
results.title: White House Ends Bar Association’s Role in Vetting Judges
results.abstract: The American Bar Association, which recently gave its highest rating to Judge Neil M. Gorsuch, will no longer evaluate candidates for the federal bench.

media.caption: Judge Neil M. Gorsuch, President Trump’s Supreme Court nominee, received the American Bar Association’s highest rating.
media.copyright: Gabriella Demczuk for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Gorsuch, Neil M;Supreme Court (US);United States Politics and Government;Filibusters and Debate Curbs;Senate;Donnelly, Joseph Simon;Democratic Party;Manchin, Joe III;Heitkamp, Heidi
results.byline: By MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT and NOAH WEILAND
results.title: Gorsuch Supreme Court Nomination Gains More Democratic Support
results.abstract: Joe Donnelly of Indiana is the third Senate Democrat to back Neil M. Gorsuch, but Republicans are still five Democratic votes short of breaking any filibuster.

media.caption: Senator Joe Donnelly of Indiana, the third Democratic senator to support the Supreme Court nomination of Judge Neil M. Gorsuch, with Senator Elizabeth Warren, Democrat of Massachusetts, on Capitol Hill in September.
media.copyright: Gabriella Demczuk for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Gorsuch, Neil M;Supreme Court (US);United States Politics and Government;Senate Committee on the Judiciary;Senate;Trump, Donald J
results.title: Senate Judiciary Committee Approves Gorsuch in Party-Line Vote
results.abstract: Judge Neil M. Gorsuch’s Supreme Court confirmation could come this week, but the words of Senator Patrick J. Leahy indicate a deep partisan split in the chamber.

media.caption: Judge Neil M. Gorsuch last month in Washington. By the end of the week, he could be the newest Supreme Court justice.
media.copyright: Eric Thayer for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Trump, Donald J;United States Politics and Government;Campaign Finance;Conflicts of Interest;Citizens United v Federal Election Commission (Supreme Court Decision);Political Action Committees;Consultants;McGahn, Donald F II;Bannon, Stephen K;Conway, Kellyanne;Priebus, Reince R;McFarland, Kathleen Troia;Gorka, Sebastian;Mercer, Robert (1946- );Greenblatt, Jason D;Passantino, Stefan C;Short, Marc
results.byline: By STEVE EDER, ERIC LIPTON and ANDREW W. LEHREN
results.title: Trump Aides’ Disclosures Reveal Surge in Lucrative Political Work
results.abstract: As cash has flooded Washington from a variety of groups, even the anti-establishment activists and operatives who sided with President Trump have been enriched.

media.caption: President Trump’s chief strategist, Stephen K. Bannon, center, reported earning more than $1 million in income tied to conservative-oriented work.

results.adx_keywords: Taxation;Trump, Donald J;Koch, Charles G;Koch, David H;Americans for Prosperity;Club for Growth;Koch Industries Inc;Republican Party;United States Politics and Government;House of Representatives;International Trade and World Market
results.byline: By NICHOLAS CONFESSORE and ALAN RAPPEPORT
results.title: Conservative Split Over Import Tax Imperils Trump’s Overhaul
results.abstract: A proposed “border adjustment” tax is meeting furious opposition, threatening to jeopardize yet another signature legislative initiative.

media.caption: An avocado packaging plant in Uruapan, Mexico, in October. President Trump has embraced the idea of an import tax for reasons that include making American products more competitive.

results.adx_keywords: United States Politics and Government;Flynn, Michael T;Russia;Income;Conflicts of Interest
results.title: Michael Flynn Failed to Disclose Income From Russia-Linked Entities
results.abstract: The former national security adviser initially did not list income from companies linked to Russia on a financial disclosure form released by the Trump administration.

media.caption: Michael T. Flynn, the former national security adviser, in January. Mr. Flynn reported an income of $1.37 million to $1.47 million.

results.adx_keywords: United States Politics and Government;Presidential Election of 2016;Podesta Group Inc;Trump, Donald J;Clinton, Hillary Rodham;Obama, Barack;United States;Russia
results.title: Trump on Twitter Renews Attacks on Clinton and Phone Tapping Claims
results.abstract: The president still insists the Obama administration spied on him, despite a lack of evidence, and he attacked Mrs. Clinton and her ex-campaign chairman, John Podesta.

media.caption: President Trump on Friday. He unleashed a series of Twitter posts on Monday, claiming once again that the Obama administration spied on him, and he attacked Hillary Clinton and her former campaign chairman.
media.copyright: Eric Thayer for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: United States Politics and Government;Courts and the Judiciary;Gorsuch, Neil M;Trump, Donald J;Appointments and Executive Changes;Senate Committee on the Judiciary;Republican Party
results.title: Senate Democrats Poised to Filibuster Gorsuch Nomination
results.abstract: The Senate Judiciary Committee approved the nomination of Judge Neil M. Gorsuch and sent it to the deeply divided full Senate.

media.caption: The Senate Judiciary Committee met to consider the nomination of Judge Neil M. Gorsuch on Monday in Washington.
media.copyright: Gabriella Demczuk for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: High Net Worth Individuals;United States Politics and Government;Cohn, Gary D;Conway, Kellyanne;Kushner, Jared;Manigault, Omarosa;McFarland, Kathleen Troia;Spicer, Sean M (1971- );Trump, Donald J;Trump, Ivanka
results.byline: By ELI ROSENBERG and ANDREW W. LEHREN
results.title: Wealthy in the White House: President Trump’s Inner Circle
results.abstract: Many of Mr. Trump’s advisers have sprawling assets and income sources, according to their financial disclosure forms.

media.caption: Gary D. Cohn in January at Trump Tower.
media.copyright: Kevin Hagen for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Baker, Gilbert (1951-2017);Deaths (Obituaries);Flags, Emblems and Insignia;Homosexuality and Bisexuality
results.title: Gilbert Baker, Gay Activist Who Created the Rainbow Flag, Dies at 65
results.abstract: Mr. Baker’s emblem, which he created in 1978, came to symbolize the gay rights movement. He described himself as the “gay Betsy Ross.”

media.caption: Gilbert Baker, heading the Stockholm Pride Parade in 2003, pieced together the first rainbow flags in 1978. He described himself as the “gay Betsy Ross.”

results.adx_keywords: Bharara, Preet;United States Attorneys;Trump, Donald J;Ethics and Official Misconduct;Justice Department
results.byline: By ERIC LICHTBLAU and WILLIAM K. RASHBAUM
results.title: White House Addresses Trump’s Unorthodox Call to Preet Bharara
results.abstract: Despite being asked repeatedly on Saturday about the nature of the call, the White House was silent until Sunday, when it said the president was trying to extend his good wishes to Mr. Bharara.

media.caption: Preet Bharara in 2016. Mr. Bharara announced on Saturday on Twitter that he had been fired after refusing to turn in his resignation.

results.adx_keywords: Trump, Donald J;United States Politics and Government;Appointments and Executive Changes;United States International Relations;State Department;Lempert, Yael;Shannon, Thomas A Jr (1958- );McGurk, Brett H
results.title: Meet the Obama Holdovers Who Survived Trump’s Sweep
results.abstract: Three diplomats from the Obama era are part of a rare cohort: officials whose skills have helped them remain in an administration bent on erasing all signs of its predecessor.

media.caption: Thomas A. Shannon Jr., second from left, who rose to the No. 3 post in the State Department in the Obama administration, welcomed Secretary of State Rex W. Tillerson, center right, during a ceremony at the department in February.

results.adx_keywords: Transgender and Transsexuals;Township High School District 211 (Palatine, Ill);Education (K-12);Bathrooms and Toilets;Civil Rights and Liberties;Discrimination;Alliance Defending Freedom;Palatine (Ill)
results.title: A Transgender Student Won Her Battle. Now It’s War.
results.abstract: A teenager known as Student A sued for access to a girls’ locker room near Chicago. She is graduating. But now Student B and Student C are on the way.

media.caption: After one transgender student’s victory at a high school district near Chicago, more cases are in the wings, including that of a transgender girl, above, identified as N.S., who has filed a discrimination complaint with the state.
media.copyright: Sally Ryan for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Kushner, Jared;Iraq;United States International Relations;Trump, Donald J;United States Politics and Government;Dunford, Joseph F Jr
results.title: Jared Kushner Visits Iraq on Invitation From Joint Chiefs Chairman
results.abstract: The purpose of the trip by Mr. Kushner, the son-in-law of President Trump, was unclear, though it came amid the fight to wrest Mosul from the Islamic State.

media.caption: Jared Kushner, President Trump’s son-in-law, in February at the White House. Mr. Trump has repeatedly turned to Mr. Kushner as an envoy to foreign leaders.

results.adx_keywords: Conflicts of Interest;United States Politics and Government;Kushner, Jared;Trump, Ivanka;Trump, Donald J
results.byline: By JESSE DRUCKER, ERIC LIPTON and MAGGIE HABERMAN
results.title: Ivanka Trump and Jared Kushner Still Benefiting From Business Empire, Filings Show
results.abstract: The White House released ethics filings from President Trump’s daughter and son-in-law and released details of a plan devised to avoid conflicts of interest.

media.caption: President Trump’s daughter, Ivanka, and her husband, Jared Kushner, leaving the Oval Office in February.

results.title: No Room for Dissent in Women’s Movement Today
results.abstract: An early champion of women’s rights says that with anti-abortion views, she’s no longer welcome in the movement.

media.caption: Cleta Mitchell, an attorney who represents Republican candidates and conservative groups, says the women’s movement has morphed into a giant abortion rights lobby.
media.copyright: Travis Dove for The New York Times
